Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Saá¹ƒghadeva of KaÅ›mÄ«ra in the Fu Qin, together with Zhu Fonian. The remaining part of the first chapter of the Abhidharma Saá¹ƒyukta, the chapter on afflictions: Is there past attachment in the body, and past, future, and present aversion?
Answer:

There may be past attachment but no past, future, or present aversion, or there may be past attachment and future aversion but not past or present, or there may be past attachment and past and future aversion but not present, or there may be past attachment and future and present aversion but not past, or there may be past attachment and past, future, and present aversion.
How is it that there is past attachment in the body but no past, future, or present aversion?
Answer:

If the fetter of craving for form and formless realms that arose before has not yet been eliminated, this is called the body being bound by the past fetter of craving, but not bound by the past, future, or present fetter of ill-will.
How is it that the body is bound by the past fetter of craving, and by the future fetter of ill-will, but not by the past or present fetter of ill-will?
Answer:

If the fetter of craving that arose in the body before has not yet been eliminated, and if the fetter of ill-will in this body has not yet been eliminated, or if it did not arise before, or if it has been eliminated and is not presently manifest, this is called the body being bound by the past fetter of craving, and by the future fetter of ill-will, but not by the past or present fetter of ill-will.
How is it that the body is bound by the past fetter of craving, and by the past and future fetter of ill-will, but not by the present one?
Answer:

If the fetters of craving and ill-will that arose in the body before have not yet been eliminated, and if the fetter of ill-will in this body is not presently manifest, this is called the body being bound by the past fetter of craving, and by the past and future fetter of ill-will, but not by the present one.
How can one be bound by past attachment and future and present aversion, but not by past aversion?
Answer:

If attachment has arisen in the body and not yet ended, and if aversion is present in the body, whether it has arisen before or not, if it has arisen it has not yet ended. This is called being bound by past attachment and future and present aversion, but not by past aversion.
How can one be bound by past attachment and past, future, and present aversion?
Answer:
If attachment and aversion have arisen in the body and not yet ended, and if aversion is present in the body, this is called being bound by past attachment and past, future, and present aversion.
If one has past, future, and present aversion, does one have past attachment?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then one is bound;
if it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then one is not bound. Seven cases of aversion are finished.
The same applies to stinginess and jealousy.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there also past pride?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past pride, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there also future pride?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is future pride, is there also past attachment?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there also present pride?
Answer:
If it is present.
If there is present arrogance and attachment, are there also past attachment and arrogance?
Answer:
If it arose before and has not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it did not arise before, or if it arose and has already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is bondage of past attachment in the body, are there past and present arrogance and attachment?
Answer:

There may be past attachment but no past or present arrogance and attachment, or there may be past attachment and past arrogance but not present, or there may be bondage of past attachment and present arrogance but not past, or there may be past attachment and past and present arrogance.
How can there be bondage of past attachment in the body but no past or present arrogance and attachment?
Answer:

If attachment has arisen before in the body and has not yet ended, and if arrogance has either not arisen before in this body or has arisen and already ended and is not presently manifest, this is called bondage of past attachment in the body but no past or present arrogance and attachment.
How can one have past attachment and past pride but not present [pride]?
Answer:

If in a certain body, the attachment and pride have arisen before and not yet ended, and in this body, the pride does not appear in the present, this is called having past attachment and past pride but not present [pride].
How can one have past attachment and present pride but not past [pride]?
Answer:

If in a certain body, the attachment that has arisen before has not yet ended, and in this body, the pride appears in the present, whether it has not arisen before or has ended, this is called having past attachment and present pride but not past [pride].
How can one have past attachment and past and present pride?
Answer:

If the knot of craving in the body has arisen in the past and not yet ended, and the knot of pride is present in this body, this is called being bound by the past knot of craving in the body and the past and present knot of pride.
If there are past and present knots of pride, are there past knots of craving?
Answer:
If they have arisen in the past and not yet ended, then they are bound.
If they have not arisen in the past, or if they have arisen and ended, then they are not bound.
If there is binding by the past knot of craving in the body, are there future and present knots of pride?
Answer:ğŸ”½Future [knots of pride] are bound, and present [knots of pride] if they are manifest.
If there are future and present knots of pride, are there past knots of craving?
Answer:
If they have arisen in the past and not yet ended, then they are bound.
If they have not arisen in the past, or if they have arisen and ended, then they are not bound.
If there is binding by the past knot of craving in the body, are there past and future knots of pride?
Answer:
If it is future, it is bound. If it is past and arose previously and has not yet ended, it is bound.
If it did not arise previously, or if it arose and has already ended, it is not bound.
If there is past and future pride, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If it arose previously and has not yet ended, it is bound.
If it did not arise previously, or if it arose and has already ended, it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past, future, and present pride?
Answer:

There may be past attachment and future pride, but not past or present. There may be past attachment and past and future pride, but not present. There may be past attachment and future and present pride, but not past. There may be past attachment and past, future, and present pride.
How does one have past attachment and future pride, but not past or present?
Answer:

If in this body, the past attachment has not yet been eliminated, and also the past arrogance has not yet been eliminated, or if it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, and also the present arrogance does not appear in this body, this is called being bound by the past attachment and future arrogance, but without past or present.
How is one bound by the past attachment and past and future arrogance, but without present?
Answer:

If in this body, the past attachment and past arrogance have not yet been eliminated, and also the present arrogance does not appear in this body, this is called being bound by the past attachment and past and future arrogance, but without present.
How is one bound by the past attachment and future and present arrogance, but without past?
Answer:

If the fetter of craving has already arisen in the body and has not yet been eliminated, and the fetter of conceit is present in the body, and the fetter of conceit has not arisen in the body, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, this is called the past fetter of craving and the future and present fetter of conceit without the past.
What is it like to have the past fetter of craving and the past, future, and present fetter of conceit?
Answer:

If the fetter of craving and the fetter of conceit have already arisen in the body and have not yet been eliminated, and the fetter of conceit is present in the body, this is called the past fetter of craving and the past, future, and present fetter of conceit.
If there is the past, future, and present fetter of conceit, is there the past fetter of craving?
Answer:
If it has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it is not bound. (The section on conceit is concluded.)
If there is the past fetter of craving binding the body, is there the past fetter of ignorance?
Answer:
It is so.
If there is past ignorance fetter, is there past craving fetter?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
Is there past craving fetter in the body, and future ignorance fetter?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is future ignorance fetter, is there past craving fetter?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
Is there past craving fetter in the body, and present ignorance fetter?
Answer:
If it is present.
If there is present ignorance fetter, is there past craving fetter?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past and present ignorance?
Answer:
If past, then bound; if present, if present.
If there is past and present ignorance, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If arisen before and not yet ended, then bound;
if not arisen before, or arisen and already ended, then not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there future and present ignorance?
Answer:
Future, then bound; present, if present.
If there is future and present ignorance, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If arisen before and not yet ended, then bound;
if not arisen before, or arisen and already ended, then not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past and future ignorance?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is past and future ignorance bondage, is there past attachment bondage?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment bondage in the body, is there past, future, and present ignorance bondage?
Answer:
Past and future are bound, and present if it is present.
If there is past, future, and present ignorance bondage, is there past attachment bondage?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound. (End of ignorance)
If there is past attachment bondage in the body, is there past view bondage?
Answer:
If it has not ended.
If there is past view bondage, is there past attachment bondage?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already ceased, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there also future view?
Answer:
If it has not yet ceased.
If there is future view, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If it has arisen in the past and has not yet ceased, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already ceased, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there present view?
Answer:
If it is present.
If there is present view, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If it has arisen in the past and has not yet ceased, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already ceased, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past and present view?
Answer:
There may be past attachment but neither past nor present views. There may be past attachment and past views but not present. There may be past attachment and both past and present views.
What is meant by having past attachment but neither past nor present views?
Answer:
If attachment arises and has not yet ended in the body, and if views have ended in that body, this is called past attachment but neither past nor present views.
What is meant by having past attachment and past views but not present?
Answer:
If attachment arises and has not yet ended in the body, and if views have not yet ended but are not presently manifest, this is called past attachment and past views but not present.
What is meant by having past attachment and both past and present views?
Answer:
If in this body, the past attachment has not yet been eliminated, and the view in this body is present, this is called the past attachment and past and present views.
If there are past and present views, are there past attachments?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen and has already been eliminated, then it is not bound.
If there is bondage of past attachment in this body, is there future or present view?
Answer:

There may be past attachment without future or present view, or there may be bondage of past attachment and future view without present [view], or there may be past attachment and future and present views.
What is meant by there being past attachment without future or present view?
Answer:
If the past attachment has not yet been eliminated, and the view in this body has been eliminated, this is called the bondage of past attachment without future or present view.
How does one have past attachment and future views but not present [views]?
The answer is:

If the attachment that arose in the body before has not yet ended, and if the views in this body have not yet ended and are also not present, this is called being bound by past attachment and future views but not having present [views].
How does one have attachment in the past and future and present views in the body?
The answer is:
If the attachment that arose in the body before has not yet ended, and if the views are present in this body, this is called being bound by past attachment and future and present views in the body.
If one has future and present views, does one have past attachment?
The answer is:
If it arose before and has not yet ended, then one is bound.
If it did not arise before, or if it arose and has already ended, then one is not bound.
Does one who has past attachment in the body have past and future views?
The answer is:
If they have not ended.
If there is past and future view-afflictions, are there past attachment-afflictions?
Answer:
If they have arisen before and not yet ended, then they are bound.
If they have not arisen before, or if they have arisen and ended, then they are not bound.
If there is past attachment-affliction bond in the body, are there past, future, and present view-afflictions?
Answer:

There may be past attachment-affliction bond without past, future, and present view-afflictions, or there may be past attachment-affliction bond and past and future view-afflictions without the present, or there may be past attachment-affliction bond and past, future, and present view-afflictions.
How can there be past attachment-affliction bond in the body without past, future, and present view-afflictions?
Answer:

If attachment-afflictions have arisen in the body and not yet ended, and if view-afflictions have ended in this body, this is called having past attachment-affliction bond in the body without past, future, and present view-afflictions.
How could there be past attachment in the body, and past and future views, but not present ones?
The answer is:

If the attachment that arose previously has not yet been eliminated, and if the views in that body have not yet been eliminated but are not present, this is called having past attachment in the body, and past and future views, but not present ones.
How could there be past attachment in the body, and past, future, and present views?
The answer is:

If the attachment that arose in the body has not yet been eliminated, and if the views in that body are present, this is called having past attachment in the body, and past, future, and present views.
If there is past, future, and present attachment to views, is there past attachment?
The answer is:
If it arose previously and has not yet been eliminated, then it is attached.
If it did not arise previously, or if it arose and has already been eliminated, then it is not attached. The seventh topic is concluded.
So are the cases with false views and doubt.

Past love, past hatred, past arrogance, one in the future, three in the present, four in the past and present, five in the future and present, six in the past and future, seven in the past, future and present arrogance, up to stinginess and jealousy are also like this.

The three defilements of the view of the self mutually include each other. Six of adherence to mere rules and rituals, twelve of perplexity, five of craving, five of hatred, and one of delusion have little inclusion.
Among the five with effluents, there are thirty-one in the effluent of sensual desire, fifty-two in the effluent of existence, and fifteen in the effluent of ignorance.
In the floods, there are nineteen in the flood of sensual desire, twenty-eight in the flood of existence, fifteen in the flood of ignorance, and thirty-six in the flood of views.
The yokes are also like this.

Among the clingings, there are twenty-four in the clinging of sensual desire, six in the clinging of mere rules and rituals, thirty in the clinging of views, and thirty-eight in the clinging of the theory of self.
Among the fetters, the fetter of sensual desire is five, the fetter of ill-will is five, the fetter of adherence to rules and rituals is six, and the fetter of adherence to a view is twelve.
Among the hindrances, sensual desire is five, ill-will is five, sloth-and-torpor, restlessness-and-worry, and doubt do not mutually include any of the proclivities.

Among the knots, the knot of ill-will is five, the knot of sensual desire and the knot of conceit are each fifteen, the knot of stinginess and the knot of envy do not mutually include any of the knots.
Among the lower fetters, sensual desire is five, ill-will is five, the view of individuality is three, adherence to rules and rituals is six, and doubt is twelve.
Among the views, the view of individuality and the extreme view are each three, wrong view and adherence to views are each twelve, and adherence to rules and rituals is six.
Among the bodily desires, the bodily desire for smell and the bodily desire for taste have a small amount of mutual inclusion with one proclivity.

The bodily desire for eye, the bodily desire for ear, and the bodily desire for body have a small amount of mutual inclusion with two proclivities. The bodily desire for mind has mutual inclusion with thirteen proclivities and a small amount of inclusion with two proclivities.

Among the fetters, the fetter of craving has five, the fetter of anger has five, the fetter of attachment to existence has ten, the fetter of pride and the fetter of ignorance each have fifteen, the fetter of views has thirty-six, and the fetter of doubt has twelve.

Among the bonds, the bond of anger has five, the bond of craving, the bond of pride, and the bond of ignorance each have fifteen, the bond of views and the bond of adherence to rules and rituals each have eighteen, the bond of doubt has twelve, and the bonds of stinginess and envy do not mutually include the various fetters.

Among the ninety-eight fetters, the view of self in the desire realm mutually includes the view of self in the desire realm, the adherence to precepts and rituals and doubt in the desire realm, up to the ignorance fetter eliminated by the path of cultivation in the formless realm and the ignorance fetter eliminated by the path of cultivation in the formless realm mutually include each other. The chapter on mutual inclusion is concluded here.
Do the three bonds and the three unwholesome roots mutually include each other, or do the three unwholesome roots mutually include the three bonds?
Answer:
They do not mutually include each other.

The three fetters and the three contaminants: the three fetters partially include two contaminants, and the two contaminants partially include the three fetters. The remaining [contaminants] do not mutually include each other.

The three fetters and the four floods: the three fetters partially include three floods, and the three floods partially include the three fetters. The remaining [floods] do not mutually include each other.
The same applies to the four grasps.

The three fetters and the four clingings: one fetter partially includes one clinging, two fetters partially include three clingings, three clingings partially include two fetters, and the remaining [fetters and clingings] do not mutually include each other.
Do the three fetters include the four bonds?
Answer:
Either a fetter is not a bond,
What is a fetter that is not a bond?
Answer:
The two fetters are called fetters that are not bonds.
What is a bond that is not a fetter?
Answer:
The three bonds are called bonds that are not fetters.
What are fetters that are also bonds?
Answer:
One fetter is called a fetter and a bondage.
What is neither a fetter nor a bondage?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
One fetter and one part of a fetter are included in one cover, and one cover includes one part of a fetter. The rest do not include each other.
Do the three fetters include the five fetters, and do the five fetters include the three fetters?
Answer:
They do not include each other.
Do the three fetters include the five lower fetters, and do the five lower fetters include the three fetters?
Answer:
Five do not include three, three do not include five.
What do they not include?
Answer:
Greed and anger.
Do the three fetters include the five views?
Answer:
Either a fetter is not a view,
What is a fetter that is not a view?
Answer:
One fetter is called a fetter but not a view.
What is meant by views that are not fetters?
The answer is:
The three views are called views that are not fetters.
What is meant by fetters that are views?
The answer is:
The two fetters are called fetters that are views.
What is meant by those that are neither fetters nor views?
The answer is:
Excluding the above.

Are the three fetters and the six kinds of attachment to the body included in the three fetters, or are the three fetters and the six kinds of attachment to the body included in the six kinds of attachment to the body?
The answer is:

They do not mutually include each other.ğŸ”½The three fetters and the seven kinds of defilements - one fetter includes one kind of defilement, two fetters include one part of one kind of defilement, one part of one kind of defilement includes two fetters, the rest do not mutually include each other.

The three fetters and the nine fetters - one fetter includes one fetter, two fetters include two parts of one fetter, two parts of one fetter include two fetters, the rest do not mutually include each other.

The three fetters and ninety-eight latent afflictions: the three fetters are included in the twenty-one latent afflictions, and the twenty-one latent afflictions are included in the three fetters. The remaining ones are not mutually included.

Up to the nine fetters and ninety-eight latent afflictions: are the nine fetters included in the ninety-eight latent afflictions, and are the ninety-eight latent afflictions included in the nine fetters?
Answer:
The nine are not the ninety-eight, and the ninety-eight are not the nine.
What are not mutually included?
Answer:
Stinginess and jealousy. The Hook-Chain Gate is finished.
How many of these three fetters are associated with the desire realm, and how many are associated with the form and formless realms?
Answer:
There are few that are included.
There are those that are included in the desire realm, those that are included in the form realm, and those that are included in the formless realm.

The taints of craving, hatred, and delusion, as well as the taints of desire, are included in the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness, and the remaining [taints] are included in the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness.

Among the floods, the flood of desire is included in the existence of desire, the flood of existence is included in the existence of form and the existence of formlessness, and the remaining [floods] are included in the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness.

The same applies to the bonds.ğŸ”½Among the clingings, the clinging of desire is included in the existence of desire, the clinging of views is included in the existence of form and the existence of formlessness, and the remaining [clingings] are included in the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness.

Among the bonds, the bodily-form and ill-will bonds are included in the existence of desire, and the remaining [bonds] are included in the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness.
The cover, anger, stinginess, and jealousy are included in the desire realm, the rest are included in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.
In the lower part, craving and anger are included in the desire realm, the rest and views are included in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.
In the six bases of craving, the craving for smell and taste are included in the desire realm, the craving for eyes, ears, and body are included in the desire realm and form realm,
the craving for mind is included in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.

In the fetters, the fetters of craving and anger are included in the desire realm, the fetter of attachment to existence is included in the form realm and formless realm, the rest are included in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.
Among the fetters, the fetters of anger, stinginess, and jealousy belong to the desire realm, while the rest belong to the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, thirty-six belong to the desire realm, thirty-one belong to the form realm, and thirty-one belong to the formless realm. (End of the third chapter on existence.)
By which samÄdhi is the view of a real self eliminated?
The answer is:
Either based on the four or based on the preliminary stage.
Stealing through precepts and doubt, either based on the four or based on the preliminary stage.
Desire, anger, delusion, and the desire outflows are based on the preliminary stage.
The existence outflows, ignorance outflows, either based on the seven or based on the preliminary stage.
Among the floods, the desire flood is based on the preliminary stage.
The existence flood and ignorance flood, either based on the seven or based on the preliminary stage.
The view flood, either based on the four or based on the preliminary stage.
The yokes are also like this.
Among the clingings, the desire clinging is based on the preliminary stage.
The receiving of precepts and the receiving of views may be based on the four or on the preliminary stage.
The receiving of self may be based on the seven or on the preliminary stage.
Among the fetters, the fetter of desire for sensual pleasure and the fetter of ill-will are based on the preliminary stage.
The fetter of adherence to rules and rituals and the fetter of the view of self may be based on the four or on the preliminary stage.

Among the six things, the hindrances and ill-will, the fetter of stinginess, and the fetter of envy are based on the preliminary stage of the first dhyÄna. The rest may be based on the seven or on the preliminary stage.
Among the lower part [of the fetters], craving and ill-will are based on the preliminary stage.
The rest and views may be based on the four or on the preliminary stage.
Among the six bases of contact, the contact of the nose and tongue are based on the preliminary stage.
The contact of the eye, ear, and body may be based on the first or on the preliminary stage.
The contact of the mind may be based on the seven or on the preliminary stage.
Among the propensities, the propensity of craving and the propensity of ill-will are based on the preliminary stage.
There are the fetters of craving, conceit, and ignorance, which may be based on seven or on the preliminary stage.
The fetters of views and doubt may be based on four or on the preliminary stage.
Among the bonds, the bonds of anger, stinginess, and jealousy are based on the preliminary stage.
The bonds of craving, conceit, and ignorance may be based on seven or on the preliminary stage.
The bonds of views, envy, and doubt may be based on four or on the preliminary stage.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, those of the desire realm are based on the preliminary stage.
Those eliminated by the four truths in the form and formless realms may be based on four or on the preliminary stage.
Those eliminated by contemplation in the formless realm may be based on seven or on the preliminary stage.
Are all the bonds that have already arisen also the bonds that one is bound by?
Answer:
Yes, all the bonds that have already arisen are the bonds that one is bound by.
Can there be bonds that one is bound by, but these bonds have not yet arisen?
Answer:
There are those who are bound by future and present fetters.
Are all fetters in the future to be fetters?
Answer:
There are future fetters that will not be fetters.
What are the future fetters that will not be fetters?
Answer:

The future fetters that are completely extinguished without remainder, already extinguished and already abandoned, in those fetters one is definitely not regressing. These are called future fetters that will not be fetters.
What are the fetters that will be fetters, but are not future fetters?
Answer:

The past fetters that are completely extinguished without remainder, already extinguished and already abandoned, in those fetters one is definitely regressing. These are called the fetters that will be fetters, but are not future fetters.
What are the fetters that are future and will be fetters?
Answer:

If one has not yet completely eliminated and exhausted all future fetters, and has not yet extinguished and spit them out, and if one is certain to regress from the complete elimination of those fetters, then one is said to be bound by future fetters.
What is meant by neither being bound by future fetters nor being bound by future fetters?
Answer:

If one has completely eliminated and exhausted all past fetters, and has already extinguished and spit them out, and if one is not certain to regress from the complete elimination of those fetters, and if one is not bound by present fetters, then one is said to be neither bound by future fetters nor bound by future fetters.
Are all fetters that are present now bound by fetters?
Answer:
Yes, all fetters that are present now are bound by fetters.
Can there be fetters that one is bound by now, but which are not present?
Answer:
Yes, all past and future fetters. The section on the locations of fetters is concluded.
By which path can one eliminate the fetters of the desire realm? If one regresses from that path, does one become bound by fetters again or not?
Answer:
One becomes bound by fetters again.
When one uses the path to sever the bonds of the form and formless realms, does one, upon falling away from that path, become bound by those bonds again, or not?
Answer:
The section on falling away from the path is concluded.
There are nine types of knowledge of elimination:
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation in the desire realm is the first knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation in the form and formless realms is the second knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truth of cessation in the desire realm is the third knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truth of cessation in the form and formless realms is the fourth knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm is the fifth knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the bonds to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the form and formless realms is the sixth knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the five lower bonds is the seventh knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of desire for form is the eighth knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of all bonds is the ninth knowledge of elimination.
Do the nine types of knowledge of elimination subsume all types of knowledge of elimination, or do all types of knowledge of elimination subsume the nine types of knowledge of elimination?
Answer:
All nine are not nine all.
What is not accepted?
Answer:

The World-Honored One's disciples who have accomplished seeing the truths, whose desire has not yet been exhausted, and whose bonds to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm are exhausted, do not accept the nine bonds to be eliminated by the two paths, and cannot attain the name of the seven bonds to be eliminated.

Those whose desire has already been exhausted, whose love for form has not yet been exhausted, and whose bonds to be eliminated by contemplation in the form realm are exhausted, do not accept the nine bonds to be eliminated.

Those whose love for form has already been exhausted, whose love for the formless has not yet been exhausted, and whose bonds to be eliminated by contemplation in the formless realm are exhausted, do not accept the nine bonds to be eliminated.
The eight people:

Those progressing towards the stream-enterer, those who have attained the stream-enterer, those progressing towards the once-returner, those who have attained the once-returner, those progressing towards the non-returner, those who have attained the non-returner, those progressing towards the arhat, and those who have attained the arhat.

As for those progressing towards the stream-enterer and those who have attained the stream-enterer, how many of these nine bonds to be eliminated do they accomplish and how many do they not accomplish?
Answer:
Either not accomplished, or one, two, three, four, or five.
How is it not accomplished?
Answer:

The forbearance of the cognition of the doctrine of suffering is not accomplished, the cognition of the doctrine of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the cognition of the unknown of suffering is not accomplished, the cognition of the unknown of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the doctrine of the accumulation is not accomplished, the cognition of the doctrine of the accumulation is one, the forbearance of the unknown of the accumulation and the cognition of the unknown of the accumulation are two, the forbearance of the doctrine of cessation and the cognition of the doctrine of cessation are three, the forbearance of the unknown of cessation and the cognition of the unknown of cessation are four, the forbearance of the doctrine of the path and the cognition of the doctrine of the path are five, and the forbearance of the unknown of the path attains the stream-enterer and accomplishes six eliminations.
As for the one who realizes the once-returner, how many of these nine eliminations are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
Answer:

If one exhausts the desires twice and attains realization in a non-sequential manner, one suddenly attains the once-returner. Therefore it is said to be twice. Either not accomplished, or one, two, three, four, five, or six.
How is it not accomplished?
Answer:

The forbearance of the cognition of the factors of suffering is not accomplished, the cognition of the factors of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of suffering is not accomplished, the subsequent cognition of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of origination is not accomplished, the cognition of the factors of origination is one, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of origination and the subsequent cognition of origination are two, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of cessation and the cognition of the factors of cessation are three, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of cessation and the subsequent cognition of cessation are four, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of the path and the cognition of the factors of the path are five, if one attains the fruit of stream-entry and progresses towards the fruit of once-returning, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of the path is six, and one attains the fruit of once-returning and accomplishes six eliminations.
For one who progresses towards the attainment of non-return, how many of these nine eliminations are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
Answer:
If one exhausts desire and attains realization out of order, either none or one, two, three, four, five, or six are accomplished.
How is it that none are accomplished?
Answer:

The forbearance of the cognition of the factors of suffering is not accomplished, the cognition of the factors of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of suffering is not accomplished, the subsequent cognition of suffering is not accomplished, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of origination is not accomplished, the cognition of the factors of origination is one, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of origination and the subsequent cognition of origination are two, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of cessation and the cognition of the factors of cessation are three, the forbearance of the subsequent cognition of cessation and the subsequent cognition of cessation are four, the forbearance of the cognition of the factors of the path and the cognition of the factors of the path are five, if one attains the fruit of once-returning and progresses to the fruit of non-returning, the two paths are counted as six.
Attaining the fruit of non-returning, one accomplishes one severance-knowledge, the severance-knowledge of the exhaustion of the five lower bonds.
For one who progresses to the realization of arhatship, how many of these nine severance-knowledges are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
The answer is:
Either one or two.
If desire for the form realm has not yet been exhausted, one accomplishes one severance-knowledge, the severance-knowledge of the exhaustion of the five lower bonds.
If desire for the form realm has already been exhausted, one accomplishes two severance-knowledges:
The severance-knowledge of the exhaustion of the five lower bonds and the severance-knowledge of the exhaustion of desire for the form realm.
Attaining arhatship, one accomplishes one severance-knowledge, the severance-knowledge of the exhaustion of all bonds.
